title: Benny Carter - Jazz Giant (1957) RESEED
description:
MP3/320kbps

Benny Carter is definitely one, having been in the jazz limelight at the time of this recording for more than twenty years. But what makes "Jazz Giant" special is that Carter&#039;s bandmates are giants in their own right -- Ben Webster, Shelly Manne, Barney Kessel, Leroy Vinnegar and Andre Previn (in the days before he became a giant of classical music). There is also trombonist Frank Rosolino, a giant talent and a casualty of the jazz lifestyle, who was sadly underrepresented on album but holds his own easily with these other greats. In terms of the album&#039;s songs, there are two Carter originals, "A Walkin&#039; Thing" and "How Can You Lose," and five standards. A final note, Benny Carter trades in his alto sax for trumpet on two tracks, and Andre Previn is replaced by Jimmy Rowles on a couple of numbers. Simply put "Jazz Giant" is one of the best straight ahead albums in all mainstream jazz.

Personnel:
Benny Carter: alto sax
Ben Webster-tenor sax
Frank Rosolino: trombone
Andre Previn, Jimmy Rowles: piano
Barney Kessel: guitar
Leroy Vinnegar: bass
Shelly Manne: drums


Track listing:
1. Old Fashioned Love
2. I&#039;m Coming Virginia
3. A Walkin&#039; Thing
4. Blue Lou
5. Ain&#039;t She Sweet
6. How Can You Lose
7. Blues My Naughty Sweetie Gives To Me
